etymology.description: Revolving around oneself -> original character for 私(私) (sī, 'selfish; private')
etymology.interpretation: The character 厶(sī, 'private') visually represents the concept of 'revolving around oneself,' symbolizing the inward-focused nature of privacy and self-interest. It originally denoted the idea of 'private' by itself and is compared to 公(gōng, 'public'). It later became part of the character 私(私) (sī, 'selfish; private'), where 禾(禾) (hé, 'grain') was added for the semantic aspect.

examples.chinese: 每个人都有一片厶土供其独处(每個人都有一片厶土供其獨處)。
examples.pinyin: Měi gèrén dōu yǒu yī piàn sī tǔ gōng qí dúchǔ。
examples.english: Everyone has a private patch of land for solitude.

examples.chinese: 他将所有厶事深藏心底(他將所有厶事深藏心底)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiāng suǒyǒu sī shì shēncáng xīndǐ。
examples.english: He hides all his private matters deep in his heart.
